subsection.name: Introduction
subsection.p: In this section we'll go through an example setup of the plugin in an example project.

subsection.name: Create a new Feed Document: RSS, Atom or Generic
subsection.p: Add a new "Feed" document (aka descriptor) anywhere in your CMS.

li.p: In the CMS, in the Content / Documents section, create a new folder called 'syndication'.
In the folder 'syndication', create some documents of type 'RSS 2.0 Feed', 'Atom 1.0 Feed' or 'Generic Feed' fill it with dummy text.

p.strong: Note: the document names are very important to remember because they will be used later on when trying to get one of the feeds.

subsection.name: Define Query parameters on your Feed Document
subsection.p: While you still have the Document open add query parameters on the right side of your document. Such as; document type, limit, etc etc.

subsection.name: Create a sitemap item in your configuration
subsection.p: In order to make your feed findable you need to add a sitemap item to your configuration. Take a look at the example from the demo. The path of the sitemap item is feed/_any_.xml. Make sure to adjust this to your situation! Keep in mind that everything you change in the CMS console is case sensitive.

subsection.name: Create a link to the Feed Document
subsection.p: You could create a link to your Feed document from anywhere in your CMS.
HST will resolve the link to the Feed.

subsection.name: Connect Beans with Entry information
subsection.p: Every Feed has one or more entries. RSS Channel has Items, Atom Feed has entries.
